texts.label: text
texts.orig: NANYANG JUNIOR COLLEGE JC 2 PRELIMINARY EXAM Higher 1
texts.text: NANYANG JUNIOR COLLEGE JC 2 PRELIMINARY EXAM Higher 1
texts.translated_text: 南洋初级学院二年级预考 高一级

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: S（这个输入似乎不完整，如果您有完整的句子或段落需要翻译，请提供详细内容。）

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Additional Materials:         Multiple Choice Answer Sheet
texts.text: Additional Materials:         Multiple Choice Answer Sheet
texts.translated_text: 附加材料：         多选答题卡

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.
texts.text: Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.
texts.translated_text: 不要使用订书钉、曲别针、胶水或涂改液。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Write your name, class, Centre number and index number in the spaces at the top of this page.
texts.text: Write your name, class, Centre number and index number in the spaces at the top of this page.
texts.translated_text: 在本页顶部的空间内填写你的姓名、班级、中心编号和索引号。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: There are thirty questions on this  paper.  Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A , B , C and D .
texts.text: There are thirty questions on this  paper.  Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A , B , C and D .
texts.translated_text: 这份试卷共有三十道题。请全部作答。每个问题有四个可能的答案A、B、C和D。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.
texts.text: Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.
texts.translated_text: 选择你认为正确的选项，并用软铅笔将你的选择记录在单独的答案纸上。

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.
texts.text: Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.
texts.translated_text: 仔细阅读答题卡上的说明。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer. Any rough working should be done in this booklet.
texts.text: Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer. Any rough working should be done in this booklet.
texts.translated_text: 每个正确答案得一分。答错不会扣分。任何草稿应在本册上完成。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The use of an approved scientific calculator is expected, where appropriate.
texts.text: The use of an approved scientific calculator is expected, where appropriate.
texts.translated_text: 适当的场合预期会使用经批准的科学计算器。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This document consists of 15 printed pages.
texts.text: This document consists of 15 printed pages.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: speed of light in free space
texts.text: speed of light in free space

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: 阿伏伽德罗常数 N A = 6.02 × 10^23 mol^-1

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The terminal velocity vT of  a  sphere  falling  through  air  of  density ρ is  given by the following expression
texts.text: 1 The terminal velocity vT of  a  sphere  falling  through  air  of  density ρ is  given by the following expression
texts.translated_text: 球体在密度为ρ的空气中下落的终端速度vT由以下表达式给出：

texts.label: text
texts.orig: where m is the mass of the sphere, g is the acceleration of free fall, A is its surface area, and D is the drag coefficient.
texts.text: where m is the mass of the sphere, g is the acceleration of free fall, A is its surface area, and D is the drag coefficient.
texts.translated_text: 其中m是球体的质量，g是重力加速度，A是其表面积，D是阻力系数。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which of the following is a unit of drag coefficient?
texts.text: Which of the following is a unit of drag coefficient?
texts.translated_text: 哪一个下列选项是阻力系数的单位？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A m -1 s B m s -1
texts.text: A m -1 s B m s -1
texts.translated_text: A m^-1 s B m s^-1

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: s（注：输入内容“s”过于简短，无法提供完整的翻译。请提供更详细的信息以便进行准确的翻译。）但由于要求只返回翻译文本，故仅翻译所给字符。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Which of the following is considered as a random error?
texts.text: 2 Which of the following is considered as a random error?
texts.translated_text: 下列哪一项被认为是随机误差？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A Error as a result of using g = 10 m s -2 , instead of g = 9.81 m s -2
texts.text: A Error as a result of using g = 10 m s -2 , instead of g = 9.81 m s -2
texts.translated_text: 使用 g = 10 m/s^2 而不是 g = 9.81 m/s^2 导致的误差

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B Error in measuring the time duration of a 100 m sprint using a stopwatch
texts.text: B Error in measuring the time duration of a 100 m sprint using a stopwatch
texts.translated_text: 使用秒表测量100米短跑的时间误差

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C Error due to a stopwatch running too fast
texts.text: C Error due to a stopwatch running too fast
texts.translated_text: 由于秒表走得太快导致的错误

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D Zero error of a measuring instrument
texts.text: D Zero error of a measuring instrument

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 A student measures two lengths as follows:
texts.text: 3 A student measures two lengths as follows:
texts.translated_text: 一个学生测量了两个长度，结果如下：

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: 该学生计算了以下内容：

texts.label: text
texts.orig: FT , the fractional uncertainty in T FTS , the fractional uncertainty in T × S FT-S , the fractional uncertainty in ( T -S )
texts.text: FT , the fractional uncertainty in T FTS , the fractional uncertainty in T × S FT-S , the fractional uncertainty in ( T -S )
texts.translated_text: FT，T的分数不确定度 FTS，T×S的分数不确定度 FT-S，(T-S)的分数不确定度

texts.label: text
texts.orig: FT+S , the fractional uncertainty in ( T + S ).
texts.text: FT+S , the fractional uncertainty in ( T + S ).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which of these has the largest magnitude?
texts.text: Which of these has the largest magnitude?

texts.label: formula
texts.orig: A FT B FTS C FT-S D FT+S
texts.translated_text: A 对 B 对 C 半对半错 D 错

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 A tennis ball is thrown vertically up. It hits the ceiling before it falls down. Assuming the effect of air resistance is negligible, which graph best represents the variation with time t of velocity v before and after hitting the ceiling?
texts.text: 4 A tennis ball is thrown vertically up. It hits the ceiling before it falls down. Assuming the effect of air resistance is negligible, which graph best represents the variation with time t of velocity v before and after hitting the ceiling?
texts.translated_text: 一个网球被竖直向上抛出。在它下落之前击中了天花板。假设空气阻力可以忽略不计，哪个图最能表示从抛出到击中天花板后速度v随时间t的变化？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Before  hitting  and  after  hitting  ceiling,  the  ball  is  under  free  fall,  with  a  constant  downward acceleration of 9.81 m s -2 ,  where  straight  downward diagonal lines are expected. During the collision with the ceiling, the downward acceleration is greater than 9.81 m s -2 as the ceiling, in addition to the weight of the ball, exerts a downward foce GLYPH<c=0,font=/AAAAAA+ArialMT> hence a more negative gradient.
texts.text: Before  hitting  and  after  hitting  ceiling,  the  ball  is  under  free  fall,  with  a  constant  downward acceleration of 9.81 m s -2 ,  where  straight  downward diagonal lines are expected. During the collision with the ceiling, the downward acceleration is greater than 9.81 m s -2 as the ceiling, in addition to the weight of the ball, exerts a downward foce GLYPH<c=0,font=/AAAAAA+ArialMT> hence a more negative gradient.
texts.translated_text: 在击打天花板之前和之后，球处于自由落体状态，具有恒定的向下加速度9.81米/秒²，因此预期会出现直线向下的对角线。在与天花板碰撞期间，向下的加速度大于9.81米/秒²，因为天花板除了球的重量外还施加了一个向下的力GLYPH<c=0,font=/AAAAAA+ArialMT>，从而导致更负的梯度。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 An object is projected with velocity 40 m s -1 at an angle of 60° to the horizontal. Air resistance is negligible.
texts.text: 5 An object is projected with velocity 40 m s -1 at an angle of 60° to the horizontal. Air resistance is negligible.
texts.translated_text: 一个物体以40米/秒的速度以60°的角度斜向上抛出。忽略空气阻力。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the speed of the object after 5.0 s?
texts.text: What is the speed of the object after 5.0 s?

texts.label: text
texts.orig: C 35 m s -1 D 45 m s -1
texts.text: C 35 m s -1 D 45 m s -1
texts.translated_text: C 35 米/秒 D 45 米/秒

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The horizontal velocity is constant at v x = u x = 40 cos 60° = 20.0 m s -1 .
texts.text: The horizontal velocity is constant at v x = u x = 40 cos 60° = 20.0 m s -1 .
texts.translated_text: 水平速度是恒定的，v_x = u_x = 40 \cos 60° = 20.0 米/秒。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The initial vertical velocity is u x = 40 sin 60° = 34.6 m s -1 .
texts.text: The initial vertical velocity is u x = 40 sin 60° = 34.6 m s -1 .
texts.translated_text: 初始竖直速度是 u_x = 40 \sin 60° = 34.6 米/秒。

texts.label: formula
texts.orig: Hence, after 5.0 s, 𝑣 = 𝑣 𝑥 2 +  𝑣 𝑦 2 = 25 𝑚 𝑠 -1 .
texts.translated_text: 因此，在5.0秒后，𝑣 = √(𝑣𝑥² + 𝑣𝑦²) = 25 米/秒。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 An archer shoots an arrow at a target. The diagram shows the path of the arrow.
texts.text: 6 An archer shoots an arrow at a target. The diagram shows the path of the arrow.
texts.translated_text: 一个射手向靶子射出一支箭。图中显示了箭的飞行轨迹。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Air resistance is assumed to be negligible.
texts.text: Air resistance is assumed to be negligible.
texts.translated_text: 空气阻力被认为可以忽略不计。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The graphs show how three different quantities, p , q and r , relating to the motion of the arrow vary with time.
texts.text: The graphs show how three different quantities, p , q and r , relating to the motion of the arrow vary with time.
texts.translated_text: 这些图表展示了与箭的运动相关的三个不同量p、q和r随时间变化的情况。

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Which  graphs  represent  the  horizontal  and  vertical  components  of the displacement of the arrow?
texts.text: Which  graphs  represent  the  horizontal  and  vertical  components  of the displacement of the arrow?
texts.translated_text: 哪一张图表示箭矢位移的水平和垂直分量？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For horizontal displacement, it increases linearly with time since horizontal velocity is constant, hence q . For vertical displacement, the arrow ascends before descends. Hence r .
texts.text: For horizontal displacement, it increases linearly with time since horizontal velocity is constant, hence q . For vertical displacement, the arrow ascends before descends. Hence r .
texts.translated_text: 对于水平位移，它随时间线性增加，因为水平速度是恒定的，因此为q。对于垂直位移，箭矢先上升后下降，因此为r。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7 Which one of the following pair of forces is not an example of action and reaction to Newton's third law ?
texts.text: 7 Which one of the following pair of forces is not an example of action and reaction to Newton's third law ?
texts.translated_text: 下列哪一对力不是牛顿第三定律作用力和反作用力的例子？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A The thrust on the rocket and expulsion of hot air due to the burning of fuel.
texts.text: A The thrust on the rocket and expulsion of hot air due to the burning of fuel.
texts.translated_text: 火箭的推力和由于燃料燃烧而排出的热气。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B The gravitational force by Earth on man standing on Earth and the gravitational force on Earth by man.
texts.text: B The gravitational force by Earth on man standing on Earth and the gravitational force on Earth by man.
texts.translated_text: 地球对站立在其上的一个人的引力和这个人对地球的引力。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C The upthrust on a piece of wood in water and the weight of the wood.
texts.text: C The upthrust on a piece of wood in water and the weight of the wood.
texts.translated_text: 水中木块所受的浮力和木块的重量。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D The magnetic force on a magnet by a long wire carrying current and the magnetic force on the wire by the magnet.
texts.text: D The magnetic force on a magnet by a long wire carrying current and the magnetic force on the wire by the magnet.
texts.translated_text: 长直导线中的电流对磁铁的作用力以及磁铁对导线的作用力。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8 A powered spaceship is moving directly away from a planet as shown below.
texts.text: 8 A powered spaceship is moving directly away from a planet as shown below.
texts.translated_text: 8 一艘有动力的宇宙飞船正像下图所示直接远离一颗行星运动。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The spaceship passes point P at t = 0. At point P, the thrusters of the spaceship are switched off  but  the  spaceship  remains  under  the  influence  of  the  planet.  Which  one of  the  following graphs best represents the subsequent variation with time t of the velocity v of the spaceship?
texts.text: The spaceship passes point P at t = 0. At point P, the thrusters of the spaceship are switched off  but  the  spaceship  remains  under  the  influence  of  the  planet.  Which  one of  the  following graphs best represents the subsequent variation with time t of the velocity v of the spaceship?
texts.translated_text: 宇宙飞船在t=0时经过点P。在点P，宇宙飞船的推进器被关闭，但宇宙飞船仍然受到行星的影响。以下哪个图最能代表飞船速度v随时间t的变化？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Gradient is equal to acceleration. As the spaceship moves away from the planet, gravitational force  acting  on  the  spaceship,  and  hence acceleration, must decrease. After the horizontal intercept where v = 0, the spaceship will be travelling toward the planet.
texts.text: Gradient is equal to acceleration. As the spaceship moves away from the planet, gravitational force  acting  on  the  spaceship,  and  hence acceleration, must decrease. After the horizontal intercept where v = 0, the spaceship will be travelling toward the planet.
texts.translated_text: 梯度等于加速度。当飞船远离行星时，作用在飞船上的引力以及由此产生的加速度必须减小。在水平截距处速度v=0之后，飞船将朝向行星飞行。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9 A car of mass 1200 kg is accelerated by a resultant force of 3000 N for a time of 5.0 s.
texts.text: 9 A car of mass 1200 kg is accelerated by a resultant force of 3000 N for a time of 5.0 s.
texts.translated_text: 质量为1200千克的小车在3000牛顿的合力作用下加速了5.0秒。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the gain in momentum of the car?
texts.text: What is the gain in momentum of the car?
texts.translated_text: 汽车的动量增加了多少？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Ans: D Ap F = t 3000 x 5.0 = 1.5x104 kg m s' A 2.5 kg m s -1 B 6.0 × 10 2 kg m s -1 C 6.0 × 10 3 kg m s -1 D 1.5 × 10 4 kg m s -1
texts.text: Ans: D Ap F = t 3000 x 5.0 = 1.5x104 kg m s' A 2.5 kg m s -1 B 6.0 × 10 2 kg m s -1 C 6.0 × 10 3 kg m s -1 D 1.5 × 10 4 kg m s -1

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10 A tractor of mass 3500 kg pulls a trailer of mass 1500 kg. The total resistive force acting on tractor and trailer has a constant value of 5000 N. One quarter of this total resistive force acts on the trailer.
texts.text: 10 A tractor of mass 3500 kg pulls a trailer of mass 1500 kg. The total resistive force acting on tractor and trailer has a constant value of 5000 N. One quarter of this total resistive force acts on the trailer.
texts.translated_text: 一辆质量为3500千克的拖拉机牵引着一辆质量为1500千克的拖车。作用在拖拉机和拖车上的总阻力有一个恒定值，即5000牛顿。这个总阻力有四分之一作用在拖车上。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When  they  are  moving  with  an  acceleration  of  1.0 m s -2 ,  what  is  the  force  exerted  on  the tractor by the trailer?
texts.text: When  they  are  moving  with  an  acceleration  of  1.0 m s -2 ,  what  is  the  force  exerted  on  the tractor by the trailer?
texts.translated_text: 当它们以1.0米每秒平方的加速度运动时，牵引车受到拖车施加的力是多少？

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ZF ma Ftractor on trailer 0.25(5000) = 1500(1.0) F 2750 N tractor on trailer By Newton's third law; Ftrailer on tractor tractor on trailer ~2750 N
texts.text: ZF ma Ftractor on trailer 0.25(5000) = 1500(1.0) F 2750 N tractor on trailer By Newton's third law; Ftrailer on tractor tractor on trailer ~2750 N
texts.translated_text: ZF 等于牵引车对拖车的力为 0.25（5000）= 1500（1.0），即牵引车对拖车的作用力为 2750N。根据牛顿第三定律，拖车对牵引车的反作用力约为 2750N。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11 A block with a pendulum bob hanging lies on a rough surface. The total mass of the block and the pendulum bob is 100 kg. A force of 250 N is applied to the block and the pendulum bob makes an angle θ to the vertical axis.
texts.text: 11 A block with a pendulum bob hanging lies on a rough surface. The total mass of the block and the pendulum bob is 100 kg. A force of 250 N is applied to the block and the pendulum bob makes an angle θ to the vertical axis.
texts.translated_text: 一个装有摆锤的木块放在粗糙的地面上。木块和摆锤的总质量为100千克。对木块施加250牛顿的力，此时摆锤与竖直方向成θ角。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the magnitude of θ if a constant frictional force of 60 N is acting on the block?
texts.text: What is the magnitude of θ if a constant frictional force of 60 N is acting on the block?
texts.translated_text: 如果一个恒定的摩擦力为60牛顿的作用在物块上，θ的角度大小是多少？

texts.label: code
texts.orig: Referring to FBD of whole system; ZF = ma 250 = 60 = 100a a =1.9 m Referring to FBD of bob, ZF mboba ZF =0 Tcos0 = mbobg (2) (1)/(2): tane =a/g =1.9/9.81 0 =110 s-2
texts.text: Referring to FBD of whole system; ZF = ma 250 = 60 = 100a a =1.9 m Referring to FBD of bob, ZF mboba ZF =0 Tcos0 = mbobg (2) (1)/(2): tane =a/g =1.9/9.81 0 =110 s-2
texts.translated_text: 参考整个系统的FBD；ZF=ma 250=60=100a a=1.9m/s^2 参考摆球的FBD，ZF=0 Tcosθ=mbobg (2) (1)/(2)：tanθ=a/g=1.9/9.81 θ=11°

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12 A thick block of wood balances horizontally on a pivot. The block and the pivot are in contact.
texts.text: 12 A thick block of wood balances horizontally on a pivot. The block and the pivot are in contact.
texts.translated_text: 一块厚木头水平地平衡在一个支点上。木头和支点是接触的。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which statement about the block is always correct?
texts.text: Which statement about the block is always correct?
texts.translated_text: 关于该区块的哪项陈述总是正确的？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A In the position shown, all the weight of the block appears to act through point P.
texts.text: A In the position shown, all the weight of the block appears to act through point P.
texts.translated_text: 在所示的位置，物块的所有重量似乎都通过点P作用。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B In the position shown, the centre of gravity of the block is located at point P.
texts.text: B In the position shown, the centre of gravity of the block is located at point P.
texts.translated_text: 如图所示，块的重心位于点P。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C When  the  block  is  given  a  small  displacement,  the  block  will  return  to  its  horizontal position.
texts.text: C When  the  block  is  given  a  small  displacement,  the  block  will  return  to  its  horizontal position.
texts.translated_text: 当块被给予一个小位移时，块会回到它的水平位置。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D When  the  block  is  given  a  small  displacement,  the moment of the weight of the block about point P is zero.
texts.text: D When  the  block  is  given  a  small  displacement,  the moment of the weight of the block about point P is zero.
texts.translated_text: 当块被给予一个小位移时，关于点P的块的重量的力矩为零。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13 The diagram   below shows a  heavy  flagpole  PQ  hinged  at a vertical  wall  at end  P and held   by  a  wire  connected  between  end  Q and a   point   R on the wall. The weight of the flagpole is W and the tension in the wire is T.
texts.text: 13 The diagram   below shows a  heavy  flagpole  PQ  hinged  at a vertical  wall  at end  P and held   by  a  wire  connected  between  end  Q and a   point   R on the wall. The weight of the flagpole is W and the tension in the wire is T.
texts.translated_text: 下图显示了一根沉重的旗杆PQ，一端P铰接在垂直墙上，并通过连接在Q端和墙上的点R之间的钢丝固定。旗杆的重量为W，钢丝中的张力为T。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the direction of the force exerted by the wall on the flagpole?
texts.text: What is the direction of the force exerted by the wall on the flagpole?
texts.translated_text: 墙壁对旗杆施加的力的方向是什么？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14 The spring used in the suspension mechanism of a vehicle has a spring constant of 100 kN m -1 .  Four such springs share equally the weight of the vehicle when it is at rest on a level road. If each spring is compressed by 4.0 cm from its natural length when the vehicle is in this situation, what is the mass of the vehicle?
texts.text: 14 The spring used in the suspension mechanism of a vehicle has a spring constant of 100 kN m -1 .  Four such springs share equally the weight of the vehicle when it is at rest on a level road. If each spring is compressed by 4.0 cm from its natural length when the vehicle is in this situation, what is the mass of the vehicle?
texts.translated_text: 一辆车的悬挂系统中使用的弹簧的弹簧常数为100千牛每米。当车辆静止在水平路面上时，四个这样的弹簧平均分担车辆的重量。如果在这种情况下每个弹簧都被压缩了4.0厘米，那么这辆车的质量是多少？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15 The engine of a boat supplies a constant power of 110 kW to propel the boat forward. The boat attains a maximum speed of 21.0 m s -1 .
texts.text: 15 The engine of a boat supplies a constant power of 110 kW to propel the boat forward. The boat attains a maximum speed of 21.0 m s -1 .
texts.translated_text: 一艘船的发动机以恒定的110千瓦功率推进船只前进，船达到的最大速度为21.0米/秒。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  the  magnitude  of  the  resistive  force  acting  on  the  boat is proportional to the square of the boat's speed, what is the resultant force acting on the boat when it is moving at the instant when its speed is 15.0 m s -1 ?
texts.text: If  the  magnitude  of  the  resistive  force  acting  on  the  boat is proportional to the square of the boat's speed, what is the resultant force acting on the boat when it is moving at the instant when its speed is 15.0 m s -1 ?
texts.translated_text: 如果作用在船上的阻力大小与船的速度的平方成正比，当船的速度为15.0米/秒时，作用在船上的合力是多少？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16 A crane is used to raise a weight of 200 N at a constant speed through a vertical height of 8.0 m in 4.0 s.
texts.text: 16 A crane is used to raise a weight of 200 N at a constant speed through a vertical height of 8.0 m in 4.0 s.
texts.translated_text: 一台起重机以恒定速度将一个重200牛的物体垂直提升8.0米，用时4.0秒。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The efficiency of the crane is 20%. What is the electrical power needed to be supplied to the crane?
texts.text: The efficiency of the crane is 20%. What is the electrical power needed to be supplied to the crane?
texts.translated_text: 起重机的效率是20%。需要向起重机供应多少电功率？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17 A person pushes a box of weight 200 N so that it moves at a steady speed along a ramp, through a height of 1.5 m. The ramp makes an angle of 30° with the ground. The frictional force on the box is 150 N while the box is moving.
texts.text: 17 A person pushes a box of weight 200 N so that it moves at a steady speed along a ramp, through a height of 1.5 m. The ramp makes an angle of 30° with the ground. The frictional force on the box is 150 N while the box is moving.
texts.translated_text: 一个人以恒定速度将一个重力为200N的箱子沿着与地面成30°角的斜坡推上1.5米的高度。在箱子移动时，作用于箱子上的摩擦力为150N。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the work done by the person?
texts.text: What is the work done by the person?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18 Two discs P and Q of mass m and 2 m respectively are placed on a rough, horizontal and level turntable as shown in the diagram. P and Q are at a distance of r and 2 r from the centre of the turntable respectively. The turntable starts rotating from rest with gradually increasing angular velocity ω .
texts.text: 18 Two discs P and Q of mass m and 2 m respectively are placed on a rough, horizontal and level turntable as shown in the diagram. P and Q are at a distance of r and 2 r from the centre of the turntable respectively. The turntable starts rotating from rest with gradually increasing angular velocity ω .
texts.translated_text: 18 两个盘子P和Q，质量分别为m和2m，如图所示放置在一个粗糙的水平转台上。P和Q分别距离转台中心r和2r。转台从静止开始以逐渐增加的角速度ω旋转。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Given that the maximum frictional force acting on P is half of that on Q, which of the following is correct?
texts.text: Given that the maximum frictional force acting on P is half of that on Q, which of the following is correct?
texts.translated_text: 给定作用在P上的最大摩擦力是Q的一半，以下哪项是正确的？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C P and Q will slip at the same time.
texts.text: C P and Q will slip at the same time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D Neither P nor Q will slip.
texts.text: D Neither P nor Q will slip.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The frictional force provides the centripetal force GLYPH<c=0,font=/AAAAAA+ArialMT> f = MRω 2 When P is about to slip, f max P = mrωmax P 2 ωmax P 2 = f max P / mr ----- eqn (1)
texts.text: The frictional force provides the centripetal force GLYPH<c=0,font=/AAAAAA+ArialMT> f = MRω 2 When P is about to slip, f max P = mrωmax P 2 ωmax P 2 = f max P / mr ----- eqn (1)
texts.translated_text: 摩擦力提供了向心力，表达式为 \( f = MR\omega^2 \)。当P点即将滑动时，\( f_{maxP} = mr\omega_{maxP}^2 \)，从而可以得到 \( \omega_{maxP}^2 = \frac{f_{maxP}}{mr} \) ---- 方程（1）

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When Q is about to slip, f max Q = (2 m )(2 r ) ω 2 = 4 mrωmax Q 2 ωmax Q 2 = f max Q / 4 mr ----- eqn (2)
texts.text: When Q is about to slip, f max Q = (2 m )(2 r ) ω 2 = 4 mrωmax Q 2 ωmax Q 2 = f max Q / 4 mr ----- eqn (2)
texts.translated_text: 当Q即将滑动时，f_max_Q = (2m)(2r)ω^2 = 4mrω_(max_Q)^2 ，因此ω_(max_Q)^2 = f_max_Q / 4mr ------ 方程(2)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: since f max Q = 2 f max P , from eqn (2)
texts.text: since f max Q = 2 f max P , from eqn (2)
texts.translated_text: 由于 f_max_Q = 2 f_max_P，由公式(2)可知

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ωmax Q 2 = 2 f max P / 4 mr = f max P / 2 mr ----- eqn (3)
texts.text: ωmax Q 2 = 2 f max P / 4 mr = f max P / 2 mr ----- eqn (3)
texts.translated_text: ω_max Q^2 = 2 f_max P / 4mr = f_max P / 2mr ------ 方程 (3)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Comparing eqn (1) and (3), ωmax Q < ωmax P . Hence Q will slip first.
texts.text: Comparing eqn (1) and (3), ωmax Q < ωmax P . Hence Q will slip first.
texts.translated_text: 比较方程（1）和（3），得到ωmax Q < ωmax P。因此Q会先打滑。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 19 Singapore is on the Equator. Cambridge is at a latitude of 52° north of the equator, as shown in the diagram.
texts.text: 19 Singapore is on the Equator. Cambridge is at a latitude of 52° north of the equator, as shown in the diagram.
texts.translated_text: 新加坡位于赤道上，如图所示，剑桥位于北纬52度。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A student at Singapore has a centripetal acceleration as because of the Earth's rotation about its axis. The Centripetal acceleration of another student at Cambridge is ac .
texts.text: A student at Singapore has a centripetal acceleration as because of the Earth's rotation about its axis. The Centripetal acceleration of another student at Cambridge is ac .
texts.translated_text: 在新加坡的一个学生由于地球绕其轴旋转具有向心加速度。另一个在剑桥的学生的向心加速度是 ac 。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What are the magnitudes of the centripetal accelerations?
texts.text: What are the magnitudes of the centripetal accelerations?
texts.translated_text: 向心加速度的大小是多少？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (radius of Earth = 6.4 × 10 6 m; angular velocity of Earth about axis = 7.3 × 10 -5 rad s -1 .)
texts.text: (radius of Earth = 6.4 × 10 6 m; angular velocity of Earth about axis = 7.3 × 10 -5 rad s -1 .)
texts.translated_text: (地球半径=6.4×10^6米；地球绕轴自转的角速度=7.3×10^-5弧度/秒。)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20 Two satellites X and Y are in orbit around the Earth. The orbital radius of satellite X is twice that of satellite Y . Which of the following correctly gives the ratio
texts.text: 20 Two satellites X and Y are in orbit around the Earth. The orbital radius of satellite X is twice that of satellite Y . Which of the following correctly gives the ratio
texts.translated_text: 两个绕地球运行的卫星X和Y。卫星X的轨道半径是卫星Y的两倍。下列哪一项正确给出了它们之间的比率

texts.label: formula
texts.orig: orbital period of X orbital period of Y ?
texts.translated_text: X的轨道周期和Y的轨道周期？

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: 答案：A 根据开普勒第三定律

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 21 An ideal cell is connected across a resistor for an unknown period of time.
texts.text: 21 An ideal cell is connected across a resistor for an unknown period of time.
texts.translated_text: 一个理想的电池连接到一个未知时间段的电阻上。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which quantities can be used to calculate the energy supplied by the cell?
texts.text: Which quantities can be used to calculate the energy supplied by the cell?
texts.translated_text: 哪些量可以用来计算细胞提供的能量？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A The current in the resistor and the resistance of the resistor.
texts.text: A The current in the resistor and the resistance of the resistor.
texts.translated_text: 电阻中的电流和电阻的阻值。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B The current in the resistor and the potential difference across the resistor.
texts.text: B The current in the resistor and the potential difference across the resistor.
texts.translated_text: 电阻中的电流和电阻两端的电势差。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C The total charge passing through the resistor and the resistance of the resistor.
texts.text: C The total charge passing through the resistor and the resistance of the resistor.
texts.translated_text: 通过电阻的总电荷和电阻的电阻值。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D The  total  charge  passing  through  the  resistor  and  the  potential  difference  across  the resistor.
texts.text: D The  total  charge  passing  through  the  resistor  and  the  potential  difference  across  the resistor.
texts.translated_text: 通过电阻的总电荷和电阻两端的电位差。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22 Some components are connected to a constant voltage supply with a voltmeter connected in the circuit. The temperature of the thermistor increases and the intensity of light incident on the light  dependent  resistor  decreases,  while  the  other  components  experience  no  physical change. In which circuit will the voltmeter reading increase?
texts.text: 22 Some components are connected to a constant voltage supply with a voltmeter connected in the circuit. The temperature of the thermistor increases and the intensity of light incident on the light  dependent  resistor  decreases,  while  the  other  components  experience  no  physical change. In which circuit will the voltmeter reading increase?
texts.translated_text: 22 一些组件连接到恒定电压电源，并且电路中还连接有一个伏特表。热敏电阻的温度升高，而光依赖电阻所受到的光照强度降低，其他组件没有发生物理变化。伏特表的读数会在哪个电路中增加？

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Ans : B Resistance of LDR increases and resistance of thermistor decreases.
texts.text: Ans : B Resistance of LDR increases and resistance of thermistor decreases.
texts.translated_text: 答案：B 随着光敏电阻的阻值增大，热敏电阻的阻值减小。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  ideal  diodes  shown  here  have  zero  resistance  in  the  forward  direction  and  inifinite resistance in the reverse.
texts.text: The  ideal  diodes  shown  here  have  zero  resistance  in  the  forward  direction  and  inifinite resistance in the reverse.
texts.translated_text: 这里所示的理想二极管在正向具有零电阻，在反向具有无穷大电阻。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In which arrangement is the potential at X equal to 8 V ?
texts.text: In which arrangement is the potential at X equal to 8 V ?
texts.translated_text: 在哪种排列下，X点的电势等于8伏？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Ans : D For A and C, no current flow as didode is reversed bias. For B, V x = 2/(2+4)12 = 4V. For D, Vx = 4/(2+4)12 = 8V.
texts.text: Ans : D For A and C, no current flow as didode is reversed bias. For B, V x = 2/(2+4)12 = 4V. For D, Vx = 4/(2+4)12 = 8V.
texts.translated_text: 答案：D 对于A和C，没有电流流动因为二极管处于反向偏置。对于B，Vx = 2/(2+4) * 12 = 4V。对于D，Vx = 4/(2+4) * 12 = 8V。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24 A battery of electromotive force (e.m.f ) 12 V and negligible internal resistance is connected to three identical resistors as shown in the diagram. The total power dissipated in the circuit is 24 W. Another identical resistor is connected in parallel to resistor R in the circuit. What is the total power dissipated now?
texts.text: 24 A battery of electromotive force (e.m.f ) 12 V and negligible internal resistance is connected to three identical resistors as shown in the diagram. The total power dissipated in the circuit is 24 W. Another identical resistor is connected in parallel to resistor R in the circuit. What is the total power dissipated now?
texts.translated_text: 一个电动势为12伏且内阻可忽略不计的电池连接到三个相同的电阻上，如图所示。电路中消耗的总功率为24瓦。现在，在电路中的电阻R上并联连接一个相同的电阻。此时电路中消耗的总功率是多少？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Ans : C With 3 resistors, total power dissipation is for the 2 resistors in parallel, V 2 / R' = 4 2 /(R/2) = 32 / R for the single resistor in series, V 2 / R = 8 2 / R = 64 /R 32/R +64/R = 24, R = 4 Ω . With 4 resistors, P = 12 2 / 4 = 36 W.
texts.text: Ans : C With 3 resistors, total power dissipation is for the 2 resistors in parallel, V 2 / R' = 4 2 /(R/2) = 32 / R for the single resistor in series, V 2 / R = 8 2 / R = 64 /R 32/R +64/R = 24, R = 4 Ω . With 4 resistors, P = 12 2 / 4 = 36 W.
texts.translated_text: 答案：C。对于三个电阻，总功率损耗为两个并联电阻的功率损耗 V²/R'=4²/(R/2)=32/R 和一个串联电阻的功率损耗 V²/R=8²/R=64/R，因此 32/R+64/R=24，解得 R=4Ω。对于四个电阻，P=12²/4=36W。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25 Five resistors are connected in the circuit as shown below.
texts.text: 25 Five resistors are connected in the circuit as shown below.
texts.translated_text: 五个电阻如图所示连接在电路中。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What is the reading in the voltmeter?
texts.text: What is the reading in the voltmeter?

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text:
0.5 V  D

注意：这里的“D”和“”符号没有明确的上下文，因此直接翻译为中文时保持不变。如果有更多背景信息或具体含义，请提供以便更准确地翻译。

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: VPQ = 0 V（注：这里的“V”可能代表伏特，如果是这样的话，完整的翻译应该是“VPQ等于0伏特”。如果没有特殊含义，“0 V”直接翻译为“0 V”即可。）根据您的要求，仅返回文本部分：VPQ = 0 V

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 26 A  cell  of  emf E and  internal  resistance r is  connected  to  a  variable  resistor R as  shown in Fig. 26.1. Fig. 26.2 shows the variation with ammeter reading I of the voltmeter reading V as R is varied.
texts.text: 26 A  cell  of  emf E and  internal  resistance r is  connected  to  a  variable  resistor R as  shown in Fig. 26.1. Fig. 26.2 shows the variation with ammeter reading I of the voltmeter reading V as R is varied.
texts.translated_text: 一个电动势为E、内阻为r的电池通过一个可变电阻R连接，如图26.1所示。当调节可变电阻R时，电流表读数I与电压表读数V的变化关系如图26.2所示。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assuming that both the voltmeter and ammeter are ideal, what is the internal resistance r ?
texts.text: Assuming that both the voltmeter and ammeter are ideal, what is the internal resistance r ?
texts.translated_text: 假设伏特表和安培表都是理想的，那么内阻r是多少？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: From Fig 24.2, E = 3.0V,  and  grpah of E I r = V is plotted, the r is the gradient of graph in 24.2 Gradient = (3 - 0.8) / 0.75 = 2.9
texts.text: From Fig 24.2, E = 3.0V,  and  grpah of E I r = V is plotted, the r is the gradient of graph in 24.2 Gradient = (3 - 0.8) / 0.75 = 2.9
texts.translated_text: 从图24.2可知，E=3.0V，并绘制了E/I-r=V的图像，其中r是图24.2中图像的斜率，斜率=(3-0.8)/0.75=2.9

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 27 A beam of electrons is directed into an electric field and is deflected by it.
texts.text: 27 A beam of electrons is directed into an electric field and is deflected by it.
texts.translated_text: 一束电子射入电场并被电场偏转。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Diagram 1 represents an electric field in the plane of the paper.
texts.text: Diagram 1 represents an electric field in the plane of the paper.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Diagram 2 represents an electric field directed perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
texts.text: Diagram 2 represents an electric field directed perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
texts.translated_text: 图2表示一个垂直于纸面的电场。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The lines A , B , C and D represent possible paths of the electron beam. All paths are in the plane of the paper.
texts.text: The lines A , B , C and D represent possible paths of the electron beam. All paths are in the plane of the paper.
texts.translated_text: 线A、B、C和D代表电子束可能的路径。所有路径都位于纸面内。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which line best represents the path of the electrons inside the field?
texts.text: Which line best represents the path of the electrons inside the field?
texts.translated_text: 哪一条线最能代表磁场中电子的运动路径？

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Ans: B The force acting on electron is always opposite to the E-field.
texts.text: Ans: B The force acting on electron is always opposite to the E-field.
texts.translated_text: 答案：B 作用在电子上的力总是与电场方向相反。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 28 An  electron  P,  having  a  speed v ,  travels  at  right-angles  to  a  uniform  magnetic  field.  P  then travels in a circular orbit of period T and orbital radius r .
texts.text: 28 An  electron  P,  having  a  speed v ,  travels  at  right-angles  to  a  uniform  magnetic  field.  P  then travels in a circular orbit of period T and orbital radius r .
texts.translated_text: 一个速度为v的电子P，以垂直于匀强磁场的方向运动。P然后在一个周期为T、半径为r的圆形轨道上运动。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Another electron Q travels at right-angles to the same magnetic field. Q travels in a circular orbit of radius 2 r . What are the period and speed of Q?
texts.text: Another electron Q travels at right-angles to the same magnetic field. Q travels in a circular orbit of radius 2 r . What are the period and speed of Q?
texts.translated_text: 另一个电子Q以垂直于同一磁场的方向运动。Q以半径为2r的圆周轨道运动。Q的周期和速度是多少？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For the first electron, F = Bqv = mv 2 /r , r = mv / Bq Since, ω = v/r  = Bq/m, T = 2πm/Bq For the second electron, same m, q, B, r' is 2r, v' = 2v, T is constant.
texts.text: For the first electron, F = Bqv = mv 2 /r , r = mv / Bq Since, ω = v/r  = Bq/m, T = 2πm/Bq For the second electron, same m, q, B, r' is 2r, v' = 2v, T is constant.
texts.translated_text: 对于第一个电子，F = Bqv = mv^2 / r ，r = mv / Bq。因为ω = v/r = Bq/m，所以T = 2πm/Bq。对于第二个电子，质量m、电荷q和磁场B相同，但r'是r的两倍，v'是v的两倍，周期T保持不变。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 29 The diagram shows a V-shaped wire in the magnetic field of flux density B .  The length of the wire in the field is L and the first half of the wire is inclined with an angle θ normal to the field direction.  The current in the wire is I .
texts.text: 29 The diagram shows a V-shaped wire in the magnetic field of flux density B .  The length of the wire in the field is L and the first half of the wire is inclined with an angle θ normal to the field direction.  The current in the wire is I .
texts.translated_text: 图中显示了一根V形导线处于磁感应强度为B的磁场中。导线在磁场中的长度为L，导线的第一部分与磁场方向垂直，与水平方向成θ角。导线中的电流为I。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Which row gives the magnitude and direction of the force acting on the wire?
texts.text: Which row gives the magnitude and direction of the force acting on the wire?
texts.translated_text: 哪一行给出了作用在导线上的力的大小和方向？

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Resolve the wire to be perpendicular to the B-field, F = B I (L/2 cosθ+ L/2 cosθ) = B I Using FLHR, direction is out of the page.
texts.text: Resolve the wire to be perpendicular to the B-field, F = B I (L/2 cosθ+ L/2 cosθ) = B I Using FLHR, direction is out of the page.
texts.translated_text: 将导线与B磁场垂直，F = B I (L/2 cosθ + L/2 cosθ) = B I，根据FLHR，方向垂直于页面向外。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 30 Four parallel conductors, carrying currents passed vertically through the 4 corners of a sqaure WXYZ.  Each of the conductor carries a current of magnitude I .
texts.text: 30 Four parallel conductors, carrying currents passed vertically through the 4 corners of a sqaure WXYZ.  Each of the conductor carries a current of magnitude I .
texts.translated_text: 三个平行导体，电流垂直通过正方形WXYZ的四个角。每个导体中的电流大小均为I。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It is required to produce a resutlant magnetic field at O , which is mid point between W and X, in the direction as shown.   What are the directions of the currents at the four corners?
texts.text: It is required to produce a resutlant magnetic field at O , which is mid point between W and X, in the direction as shown.   What are the directions of the currents at the four corners?
texts.translated_text: 在W和X的中点O产生一个如图所示方向的合成磁场。四个角上的电流方向是什么？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B field due to W will in the required direction if I in W is into the plane.
texts.text: B field due to W will in the required direction if I in W is into the plane.
texts.translated_text: 如果W中的电流垂直指向平面内，则W产生的B场将在所需的方向上。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B field due to Z will in the required direction if I in Z is into the plane.
texts.text: B field due to Z will in the required direction if I in Z is into the plane.
texts.translated_text: 如果Z中的电流进入平面，则Z引起的B场将在所需方向上。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: By the same reasoning, then current at X and Y will have to be out of the plane to give the resultant as required.
texts.text: By the same reasoning, then current at X and Y will have to be out of the plane to give the resultant as required.
texts.translated_text: 由此推理，那么在X和Y处的电流必须位于平面外，以达到所需的结果。

table_cells.translated_text: 对不起，您能提供需要翻译的文本吗？
